document.title: English Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools March 2024

0428667912DA461FB7C32116330C752F.description:
Demonstrate ethical and responsible use of all sources, including the Internet, Artificial
Intelligence (AI), and new technologies, as they develop.

44B43CE0094D45DAB38A7BB328BA230F.description:
Cite primary and secondary sources using the Modern Language Association (MLA) or
American Psychological Association (APA) style.

D0674DEA05614F9E9945797B54F1273D.description: Organize and share findings in formal and informal oral or written formats.

F10926C6A94A4663B3BCC4139C7B88AD.description:
Quote, summarize, and paraphrase research findings from primary and secondary sources,
avoiding plagiarism by using own words and following ethical and legal guidelines.

E9C326693ADE44459D08D7B84FAEBF19.description:
Evaluate and analyze the relevance, validity, and credibility of sources (primary,
secondary, digital, and print) identifying main and supporting ideas, conflicting
information, points of view, and any biases.

EAD0747FA5C94403BA9FC9AFB33FC653.description:
Collect, organize, and synthesize information from multiple sources using various
notetaking formats.

5F18101DB55843F0B35FCACB3CCD6EA6.description:
Formulate and revise questions about a research topic, broadening or narrowing the inquiry
as necessary.

F1671A5E859146E5A5079CD9D3B79165.description:
The student will conduct research and read a series of conceptually related texts on
selected topics to build knowledge on grade-eight content and texts, solve problems, and
support cross-curricular learning.

433BBD9EB19A4A86A0FD8101ADE7A9F5.description:
Evaluate sources for their relationships, motives, intent, and content (e.g., social,
emotional, commercial).

2BD0B4BFCFAA46A8807E984D8A6759F8.description:
Analyze how similar information is presented in diverse media formats by examining
electronic, print, propaganda, and mass media.

0FF225DD7AB54FF8BFCF2EB2C806140A.description:
Examine how the media can influence beliefs, behaviors, and interpretations by using
persuasive techniques (e.g., name calling, innuendo, glittering generalities, card stacking,
bandwagon, testimonials, appeal to prestige, snobbery or plain folks, appeal to emotions).

BD0D963B7579473BBDB23DF6BDD59F75.description:
Craft and publish audience-specific media messages that present claims and findings with
relevant evidence and reasoning.

D3D388CE9C574ECCA4BD00A050D6EBF0.description:
Uses two or more communication modes to make meaning (e.g., still or moving
images, gestures, spoken language, and written language).

4ACEC253EECC486B9386009876CBCF90.description: Uses pertinent descriptions, facts, and details.

A120B7314A67430D9467454BE0632E7D.description: Plan and present a multimodal presentation that

D8EF4404AAF44F18ADD59B2BC74A7718.description: Referencing source material as appropriate during the presentation.

35DD1A81BE974BBDB1FDB21C913F92BE.description:
Responding to audience questions and comments with relevant evidence, observations,
and ideas.

D9C2F9FC00004300807636EE0CCB9636.description:
Using language and vocabulary appropriate to the audience, topic, and purpose,
including speaking clearly at an understandable pace with appropriate tone and volume.

D289578FC2FE44569317C5DC4FA09ABE.description:
Incorporating pertinent descriptions, facts, details, and examples to support the main
ideas.

C9A09B25BD234A929D5A92728D8EB8BF.description: Clearly communicating information in an organized and succinct manner.

9CD12ED3347D4A7EA5333B6DB80DB587.description:
Deliver collaborative and individual formal and informal interactive presentations This
includes:

20E76FAC5DB94AC7A0433F3F625E53E2.description:
Using self-reflection to evaluate one’s own role in preparation and participation in
small-group activities.

BC3A0FEC007C44DC8DEE73ED92C2C682.description:
Valuing contributions made by each group member while exhibiting a willingness
to make necessary concessions to accomplish a common goal.

F30E2D3AD7AE432BB8D98B66D07C32B6.description:
Acknowledging new insights expressed by others, and, when justified, modifying
their own views.

A5E4D9A3876746B196CC9BA533840F5E.description: Thoughtfully paraphrasing and summarizing ideas made during discussions.

3EC320F808D24A12ACB46A4116F3E57D.description:
Communicating agreement or tactful disagreement with others’ ideas, using
carefully constructed responses.

C8487E3BB8F641C4A3B05E0E91AA6D5C.description:
Asking clarifying questions and responding appropriately to others’ questions to
encourage discussion, foster understanding, and maintain focus on the topic.

DACE69B7FBBA4E1280500FC61061F3F2.description: Working effectively and respectfully by actively contributing relevant and wellsupported ideas and opinions and sharing responsibility for the collaborative work.

B0E2A3514FB94A30AE92DDBBAC5A0465.description:
Listening actively, offering and seeking ideas, and setting guidelines for
presentations and discussions.

79D4378DD41B4EDEBB545469675558AE.description:
Facilitate and contribute to a range of sustained collaborative discussions with diverse
partners on grade eight topics and texts. This includes:

C3479DFCD1494B81A610E7C2F6F89640.description:
The student will develop effective oral communication and collaboration skills to build a
community of learners that process, understand, and interpret content together.

CF1358D1FB58453B860591E7975F20B1.description: Consult reference materials to check and correct spelling.

6CF6719B5FB04551B96B2088DA7A7B2B.description: Recognize and consistently spell frequently used words accurately.

612D48351F104770A06B83D5AA5A451C.description: Use and punctuate dialogue and direct quotations appropriately in writing.

D9A3B6F8CC8644C0BE8F65DE53106E2B.description:
Construct complete sentences with appropriate punctuation, avoiding comma splices and
run-ons in writing.

280AAEDE08D7495AA0240815FCF573B0.description: Maintain consistent verb tense across paragraphs in writing.

22674A71B59945198C6DD15360B33AA8.description:
. Arrange phrases and clauses within a sentence to improve meaning reader/listener interest,
and style in writing.

28B8271CDC7B4829A09243112925550D.description: Use specific adjectives and adverbs to enhance speech and writing.

140022F0F95347FAB40865F5D728A465.description:
Recognize and use pronoun-antecedent agreement, including indefinite, reflexive, and
relative pronouns, when speaking and writing.

AB5264DE515C442FAFD776497BE5DC72.description:
Construct simple, compound, complex, and compound-complex sentences to communicate
ideas clearly and add variety to writing.

5F13C25E8312471AA20907E80FB65F97.description:
The student will use the conventions of Standard English when speaking and writing,
differentiating between contexts that call for formal English and situations where informal
discourse is more appropriate.

1AF87A069C7245DF8D7E24EDBA100BBC.description:
Self-and peer-edit writing for capitalization, spelling, punctuation, sentence structure,
paragraphing, and Standard English (See Language Usage for grade level expectations).

EF265426002948E68048F177DED92058.description:
Revise writing for clarity of content, word choice, sentence variety, and transition among
paragraphs.

EB96CD85F89D4A82AAFA8E582A6FFE21.description: Providing a concluding statement or section.

DB905D2B181B44B5A2E958779D3F548F.description: Expanding and embedding ideas to create sentence variety.

8ECDCEF531D44548BC436E2F2782014E.description:
Developing voice and tone by using language that provides vivid and precise
vocabulary to enhance the meaning of the writing.

C9D6DCE79E724B72B0614AFA317A2436.description:
Using appropriate and varied transitions to signal shifts in writing to clarify the
relationships among ideas and concepts.

453869E0F96F424C998E821FF683A1DE.description:
Stating and defending conclusions or positions with reasons and precise, relevant
evidence and complete explanation of how evidence and details support a position
addressing counterclaims when appropriate.

D5D3A98CA54A4FA687DA2CAA61550526.description:
Establishing a central idea that aligns with the thesis and maintaining an organized
structure and formal style to fit form and topic, providing elaboration and unity
throughout the writing and maintaining a consistent point of view.

0901F4CF74504A33B5533A06212FC238.description: Composing a thesis statement that states a position or explains the purpose.

17E7F82DC02949B3855DD4EE3AEE06CB.description:
Generate and organize ideas using the writing process (planning, drafting, revising, editing)
to develop multi-paragraph texts. This includes:

66FEB893CD1E43BF96E7B7407A2F0C99.description:
Write reflectively in response to reading to demonstrate thinking with details, examples,
and other evidence from the text(s).

C244DA170CD5498590B393274D3EDA1C.description:
Write persuasively, supporting well-defined points of view effectively with relevant
evidence and clear reasoning in ways that logically advance the claim(s) made.

1627A0BA5915405A8C994D02EC274053.description:
Write expository texts to examine a topic or concept that conveys ideas and information by
maintaining a clear focus with relevant, well-chosen facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, and examples from multiple credible sources, using structures and patterns
(e.g., description, enumeration, classification, comparison, problem-solution, or causeeffect) to clarify relationships among ideas and concepts.

BCDCBCE76A3D47DFA0315D79131893DC.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or to alter an existing text, using
well-structured event sequences, precise words and phrases, and transitional words to
develop the characters, convey sequence, and capture the action.

0A2E1DB2AAB142499EF555AFAE450D6F.description:
The student will compose various works for diverse audiences and purposes, linked to
grade eight content and texts.

7F684D43DC654B96AA5055DC8B77162B.description: See Kindergarten through grade five for Foundations for Writing standards.

FDC8C313183445C28A265649EE3B4039.description:
Compare and contrast how two or more authors present conflicting information on the
same topic by assessing where the texts disagree in reasoning and evidence.

860B4B77EA6A49BFA077F3025EF8B6CC.description:
Analyze ideas within and between selections including how specific sentences, paragraphs,
sections, and text features contribute to the development and refinement of the ideas
presented.

103F7B93909346F18A306CEA1E64B57E.description:
Analyze how an author establishes and conveys a perspective or purpose in a text and
acknowledges and responds to conflicting evidence or viewpoints.

E7F61213210646C58596B04419905FD4.description:
Analyze how an author’s word choice, organizational pattern, language structure,
viewpoints, and qualifications impact meaning and credibility of a text.

98FC5DBECC784CAAA03064467F091C27.description:
Evaluate an author’s use of text features (e.g., boldface and italics; type set in color;
underlining; indentation; sidebars; illustrations, graphics, and photographs; headings and
subheadings; footnotes and annotations) to enhance and support the reader’s
comprehension.

976BBED4E3FE4E79B5F1DBAE22AEBA63.description:
Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the
reasoning and evidence are relevant and sufficient to support the claims.

40EA9C4E0B774470BE662D2373A99F03.description:
Analyze how the author unfolds a perspective or series of ideas or events in historical,
scientific, or technical texts, including the order in which the points are made, how they are
introduced and developed, and the connections drawn between them.

BA3764415BEE48B6AA0B0C1943E02BEC.description:
Create a main idea statement and provide an accurate summary, clarifying the relationships
among the key details and ideas or events.

A5B23C99DBF04D6F90CD72D129171CA8.description:
The student will use textual evidence to demonstrate comprehension and build
knowledge from grade-level complex informational texts read.

7DBAA004B94B4FB488CDC70A7AFC6CA5.description:
Compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres (e.g., stories and poems; historical
novels and fantasy stories; literary nonfiction and informational) in terms of their
approaches to similar themes and topics.

80484A78350C4F06994B78785F03CAE7.description:
Compare and contrast fictional portrayals of a time, place, or character with historical
accounts of the same period as a means of understanding how authors of fiction use or alter
history.

59889E0A1ECB4A79AD5A93681C75CE71.description:
Compare and contrast the structure of two or more stories, poems, and plays and analyze
how the differing structure of each literary text contributes to its meaning and style.

A22045946B8E4E76A22E301E9DF5DBD2.description:
Analyze how an author’s use of literary devices including foreshadowing, flashback,
symbolism, and irony are used to build mystery, suspense, or surprise.

D968E2BB5B504DFDB07E05DC0E871FF5.description:
Analyze how an author develops and contrasts the points of view of different characters or
narrators in a text.

C8B8A0D211874713BB4FE59F041F47A1.description:
Analyze how the elements of an author’s style (e.g., dialogue, sentence structure and word
choices) are used to influence and develop tone and voice.

8E52CC98A0FD4A9DB1291FFB1786A50F.description:
Interpret the meaning and analyze the impact of poetic elements in prose and poetry (e.g.,
rhyme, rhythm, repetition, alliteration, and onomatopoeia) on the reader.

E41AA954377746A0A76D57D72172C34F.description:
Justify the decisions and actions of dynamic versus static characters using dialogue or
specific events from the text.

14E77F05C3364A16904422FEEB493032.description:
Explain how different plot patterns (e.g., comedy, drama, tragedy) and subplots create
meaning and examine their influence on characters, theme, pacing, and point of view.

8303460006E14A2F9DD8109AA86627C3.description:
Analyze and explain the development of theme(s) over the course of texts and their
relationship to the characters, settings, plots, and overall messages.

CE9972D55BA84CC0B61D86C3E0DEDBF9.description:
The student will use textual evidence to demonstrate comprehension and build
knowledge from a variety of grade-level complex literary texts read to include short stories,
literary nonfiction, novels, poetry, and drama.

8C968EEC3A584A1DB4DC5035523C30B7.description:
Use newly learned words and phrases in multiple contexts, including in students’
discussions and speaking and writing activities.

4BAC014C9C284772BE74A9C6555C39A8.description:
Use general and specialized word-reference materials, print and digital, to determine
pronunciation, etymology, derivations, and parts of speech.

F391B3BD6ED74475986EA046609BDB5A.description: Discriminate between the meanings of connotative words and their denotative meanings.

427B8B0A566642269D3946054D5947B7.description:
Analyze the construction and meaning of an author’s use of symbols, analogy, and
figurative language such as simile, metaphor, personification, hyperbole, and idiom.

AC41728AEB0D4C0C8E53EF4F45B53BE2.description:
Use the relationship between particular words, including synonyms, antonyms, and
analogies to better understand each word.

FDC1C23747CA4CF893AD92CC270A6D8A.description:
Apply knowledge of Greek and Latin roots and affixes to determine the meaning of
unfamiliar words.

CE5CAF2321A14647887822145884EF10.description:
Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or
function in a sentence) to determine the meaning of words or phrases.

5E44BF2384FB467FAC4716D24AD63283.description:
Develop and accurately use general and academic language and content-specific
vocabulary by listening to, reading, and discussing a variety of grade-eight texts and topics.

FE584EABC6D9459C8BE177CD7E0BA3BF.description:
The student will systematically build vocabulary and word knowledge based on grade
eight content and texts.

A66E283758334A3DBEC7BD7CE9DEE619.description:
Use reading strategies as needed to aid and monitor comprehension when encountering
challenging sections of text. These sense-making strategies attend to text structure,
common organizational structures, summarizing, asking questions of the text, and others
(Reading Strategies, 3-12).

0B0B3E2ABC524CC584F9FD6016A64769.description:
Regularly engage in reading a series of conceptually related texts organized around topics
of study to build knowledge and vocabulary. (These texts should be at a range of
complexity levels so students can read the texts independently, with peers, or with modest
support.) Use this background knowledge as context for new learning (Deep Reading on
Topics to Build Knowledge and Vocabulary, K-12).

996973D3F5D740D286022BB2D20661CB.description:
When responding to text through discussion and/or writing, draw several pieces of
evidence from grade-level complex texts to support claims, conclusions, and inferences,
including quoting or paraphrasing from texts accurately and tracing where relevant
evidence is located (Textual Evidence, K-12).

C81A3B3CFCF2434FB6D730C43D18D943.description:
Proficiently read and comprehend a variety of literary and informational texts that exhibit
complexity at the higher range of the grades 6-8 band (See the Quantitative and Qualitative
Analysis charts for determining complexity in the Appendix.) (Text Complexity, 2-12).

DF1F181C3244497FB2677405A2CF71D4.description:
Read a variety of grade-level complex text with accuracy, automaticity, appropriate rate,
and meaningful expression in successive readings to support comprehension. Monitor
while reading to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, as necessary
(Reading Fluency, K-12).

7A8EBEE4F89249F39F39CF195ABF5B33.description:
The student will build knowledge and comprehension skills from reading a range of
challenging, content-rich texts. This includes fluently reading and gathering evidence from
grade-level complex texts, reading widely on topics to gain purposeful knowledge and
vocabulary, and using reading strategies when comprehension breaks down.

B761D80CCEAC455581BFFDA30815A077.description: Developing Skilled Readers and Building Reading Stamina

5D25FBAED0734B05886C1CD1A0003B3F.description: See Kindergarten through grade five for Foundations for Reading standards.
